data.name: H-2A Work Visas
data.description: For agricultural workers with temporary or seasonal job offers in the United States.
detailedInfo: The H-2A visa allows U.S. employers who anticipate a shortage of domestic workers to bring foreign nationals to the U.S. to fill temporary agricultural jobs.
This program is vital for the agricultural sector.

data.name: H-2B Work Visas
data.description: Intended for non-agricultural workers to fill temporary jobs in the U.S. across various sectors.
detailedInfo: The H-2B visa is for workers in non-agricultural occupations.

data.name: B1/B2 Visa (Tourism and Business)
data.description: Allows entry to the U.S. for tourism, visits, medical treatments, or temporary business activities.
detailedInfo: The B-1 visa is for temporary business visitors, while the B-2 visa is for tourism, visits to family, or medical treatments.

data.name: TN Visa (USMCA Professionals)
data.description: For qualified professionals from Mexico and Canada under the USMCA to work temporarily in the U.S.
detailedInfo: The TN visa, derived from the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), allows qualified Mexican and Canadian citizens to work in the U.S. in pre-established professions.

sections.title: 1. Identity and Contact Details of the Controller
sections.content: XAGA, S.C. (hereinafter, "XAGA"), located at Olimpia No. 1521 Col. Nueva Linda Vista, Guadalupe, N.L., is the controller of your personal data. This Privacy Notice aims to inform you about your rights under the Federal Law on Protection of Personal Data Held by Private Parties (LFPDPPP). If you have any questions, you can contact us at: privacy@xaga.com.

sections.title: 2. What Personal Data Do We Collect?
sections.content: You can browse our website without providing personal data. However, you may voluntarily provide us with identification, contact, employment, billing, and, if applicable, recruitment data. It is important to mention that XAGA does not collect sensitive personal data.

sections.title: 3. Purposes of Processing Your Personal Data
sections.content: Your data is used for necessary purposes such as verifying your identity, administering legal services, and answering your inquiries. Additionally, we may use it for secondary purposes such as sending you our newsletter or for marketing purposes, from which you can opt-out at any time.

sections.title: 4. Transfer of Personal Data
sections.content: XAGA will not transfer your personal data to third parties, unless there is a legal obligation or it is strictly necessary to fulfill the described purposes.

sections.title: 5. Exercise of Your ARCO Rights
sections.content: You have the right to Access, Rectify, Cancel, or Oppose (ARCO) the processing of your data. To exercise these rights, or to revoke your consent, please submit your request to: privacy@xaga.com.

sections.title: 6. Use of Cookies and Tracking Technologies
sections.content: Our website uses 'cookies' to generate statistics and improve your experience. You can disable these technologies in your browser settings.

sections.title: 7. Security Measures
sections.content: XAGA has adopted and maintains the necessary administrative, technical, and physical security measures to protect your personal data.

sections.title: 8. Minors
sections.content: We do not intentionally collect data from minors without the express consent of their parents or guardians.

sections.title: 9. Changes to the Privacy Notice
sections.content: Any changes to this privacy notice will be communicated through our website.
